intro: Papaver apulum var. gracillimum, commonly known as the slender poppy, is a variety of the Persian poppy characterized by its delicate, pale pink to white flowers. It is a herbaceous perennial that typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, featuring slender stems and narrow, lance-shaped leaves. The flowers bloom in late spring to early summer, adding a subtle yet striking visual element to gardens. Native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia, this plant thrives in well-drained soil and full sun. Its botanical features make it a sought-after ornamental plant for its elegant appearance and relatively low maintenance requirements.
